answers.answer: Hi. I'm pregnant for the 4th time and I am Rh negitive. I have never had a problem. I have always received Rhogam at 28 weeks and after delievery ( 1 time after a D&C ). Both of my boys are Rh positive, as is my husband. It is not a big deal as long as you receive rhogam. I understand why you are concerned. I was nervous with my first pregnancy and the Rh negative issue-but it all worked out fine!

I'm Rh negative and was assured that it would not be a problem. I received Rhogam after a D&C and had similar concerns.  Especially b/c I had miscarried. But the Dr. and Nurse assured me that being Rh Negative had nothing to do with the miscarriage and would not cause me any problems with future pregnancies - as long as I have the Rhogam at 28 weeks.  The Nurse was apparently Rh negative as well and showed me pics of her two healthy children.  I think we're extremely lucky that there is Rhogam.  It was, I think, not discovered until the 70's and before that, there would have been absolutely nothing Dr.'s could do for us.As for the GD, my Mother and close friend both had it and delivered healthy babies. My brother is living proof!  Just follow their recommendations and I am sure you will have the healthiest of pregnancies. I imagine it is overwhelming to learn all of this but just remember you have a wee one inside you that has been growing happily all along and will continue to do so with your support.
